intro: Peltaria turkmena, commonly known as Turkmenian peltaria, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought tolerance. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a head. Peltaria turkmena is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
